sn45.11:1: At Sāvatthī. "Bhikkhus, I wish to go into seclusion for half a month. I should not be approached by anyone except the one who brings me almsfood."[n.8]Spk: Why does he speak thus? During that half-month, it is said, he had no one to guide. Then he thought, "I will pass this half-month in the bliss of fruition attainment. Thus I will enjoy a pleasant abiding and set an example for future generations."
sn45.11:2: Then, when that half-month had passed, the Blessed One emerged from seclusion and addressed the bhikkhus thus:
